page.title: 20BISHOPS CASTLE RAILWAY
page.content:
The railway was opened in 1861. It was intended to link the town with the outside world by connecting with the Oswestry and Newtown Railway at Montgomery and with the Shrewsbury and Hereford Railway at Wistanstow.
There was some local opposition and a lack of money,which dogged the line all its life.
The line to Montgomery was never built and the company struggled along always near bankruptcy until 1937 when the last train to Craven Arms ran.
The line was taken up, the rolling stock sold or broken up, and all that remains are some bits of the platform and station buildings. The Railway Boom had passed Bishops Castle by.
